meanings.definition: The act of making information available to the public.
meanings.sent1: The school's newsletter is a publication that shares important news with students and parents.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy reading the latest publication from my favorite magazine every month.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meowing could be considered a publication of its hunger.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a publication of her happiness, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright neon sign was a vivid publication of the new store opening.

meanings.definition: A printed work made available to the public.
meanings.sent1: The library has a vast collection of publications, including books and magazines.
meanings.sent2: I bought the latest publication of my favorite author's novel.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's acorn stash could be considered a tiny publication of its hard work.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a colorful publication of her creativity.
meanings.sent5: The newspaper headline was a striking publication of the breaking news.

meanings.definition: The act of officially announcing or proclaiming something.
meanings.sent1: The publication of the election results brought excitement to the town.
meanings.sent2: The government's publication of new laws is crucial for citizens to stay informed.
meanings.sent3: The bird's loud chirping could be seen as a publication of the morning's arrival.
meanings.sent4: His victory dance was a publication of his joy and pride.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm was a dramatic publication of nature's power.
